headline: Carol's Chicken Salad
description: Tender chicken breast chunks are mixed with sweet green grapes, diced Swiss cheese, crunchy celery, and minced green onions, and folded into a tangy, creamy dressing.
name: Carol's Chicken Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 cups diced, cooked chicken breast meat
1 (8 ounce) can water chestnuts, drained and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, salt, poultry seasoning, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, and lemon juice.
In a large bowl, toss together the chicken, celery, green onions, water chestnuts, Swiss cheese, and grapes. Add the mayonnaise mixture, and stir to coat. Chill until serving.

review.reviewBody: I have been making this recipe for at least 10 years. It’s my favorite chicken salad recipe ever. It’s so versatile. I’ve made it exactly as written many times. I also change it up. I usually leave out the water chestnuts but I always add either chopped walnuts or slivered almonds. I’ve swapped the grapes for apples. I’ve address dried cranberries or omitted the cheese. It always comes out perfect!!
A lot of work for a chicken salad. It tasted good but I prefer keeping chicken salad simple.

This was Sooo good,I use to get one over 30 years ago thats similar at a restraunt after moving out of area never had good one again till now I added extra half c mayo and squirt of djon mustard,I sprinkled McCormick chicken rotisserie Seasoning on breasts before cooking.i didn't add chestnuts or cheese. Served on crossaints.
So good! We love this salad! Left out the water chestnuts and it was simply lovely!
Our family loves this chicken salad!!
Amazing!
Don't change a thing! A real keeper

What a GREAT summer salad. Very good for a light lunch or dinner. I made this as directed, except adding a few red grapes I needed to use. Several of us really enjoyed this in a wrap, too. I will be keeping this recipe handy!

This particular chicken salad has an interesting flavor but I found it to be too salty. I would start with 1/4tsp salt and build from there. I also added a large Granny Smith apple since I had no grapes. I love the tang that Granny Smith apples give.

This is very, very good! I missed the swiss cheese ingredient when I was shopping. I had extra sharp cheddar on hand. cut it into very small cubes and it was still delicious. I used th e breasts from a rotisserie chicken because it was easy. I will definitely be making this again!
No changes. I will make again
Delicious!

Best chicken salad I’ve ever tasted! I did make a couple of changes: used Miracle Whip instead of mayonnaise and Feta cheese crumbles instead of Swiss cheese. Tastes fine with the Swiss but we like the flavor of Feta more and it isn’t as ‘rubbery’ as Swiss. Also added dried cranberries- delicious!

I made the recipe as is. The poultry seasoning was odd and overpowering. I grated the Swiss cheese and quartered the grapes (just to try and avoid any one flavor dominating a bite). It was def better on day two than day one. Now that I have made it and read reviews, I am sure the recipe would improve a lot with changes (i.e., less poultry seasoning, add nuts), but I’m so blah about it that I doubt I will try the recipe, again.
Perfect chicken salad. Made it for a family brunch and it was a hit

Five stars if you do not add the poultry seasoning!! It was amazing and a huge hit. Two stars if you do. The first time I made this I did not have poultry seasoning and it was fabulous. I should have left it alone but 2nd time added and yuk completely overpowered all the other ingredients also don’t add the salt it doesn’t need it. So disappointed

The recipe is great as it is. made it and i must say the taste is great. Will definetly make again. 
followed the recipe to a T with no changes whatsoever. it's a keeper
Delicious. I don't care for the flavor of poultry seasoning so I just marinate chicken in balsamic vinegar dressing then grill.
i didn't have the swiss cheese so i omitted that. and I didn't have poultry seasoning so I substituted that for goya adobo all purpose seasoning.

We LOVE this chicken salad !! I do make a few changes that we have liked a bit better, first we do not use any poultry seasoning, instead of green grapes we use red grapes and instead of water crescents we use red apples!

Really delicious chicken salad! I used a medium-sized cooked breast, so scaled it down to 5 servings. I didn't use water chestnuts, but did add chopped walnuts. I had some Miracle Whip that needed to be used, so I went with that. It worked well here. I never added Swiss cheese to chicken salad, but it really complements the other flavors. After reading reviews, I cut back on the poultry season which I think was a good call. After testing, I did add more of the spices. I'll have to get some croissants....this would be great served on those. Thanks for this gourmet-like chicken salad!
Loved it

Wow! Love it! I used smoked chickens I had left over and used red grapes too. I did not have water chestnuts but I’m sure they would have been great. I’m typically not fond of chicken salad, but this is a game changer! Thank you!

Yes, I will definitely make it again!!! Husband had 2 bowls of it! Changes that I made:
I doubled all the spices except for the pepper and salt. 
I also doubled the lemon juice. 
Instead of Swiss cheese I put Chipotle Monterrey Jack cheese instead.
Used Stephanies suggestions and it was great!
Very good chicken Salad. I added apple & onion instead of water chestnuts & green onion.. I also put the grass on the side. This is one to add to the recipe book...I will definitely make this again.
Very good for chicken salad sandwiches! Quite tasty!

I love this recipe. I sub half the mayo for poppyseed dressing and add a finely diced pink lady or honey crisp apple for the water chestnuts. I have made it before exactly as it is written, but I’ve gotten more compliments with my additions. It’s a great salad.

This is our go to with our roasted chicken leftovers. So needless to say we eat it at least 2-3 times a month. The only changes made is we don’t use the poultry seasoning (we don’t like it) and we add a little extra lemon juice. Love it. Would recommend following the recipe first, then next time see if you want to make changes. You may find it perfect just the way it is.
It was good. I decreased the poultry seasoning by just a bit. I think it needs more mayo. Not very creamy at all. This is not your traditional chicken salad
Made it exactly as the recipe called for. Delicious! Will definitely make again.
Eyeballed everything and made up my own poultry seasoning. Brought with on a road trip and we loved it!

I make this exactly like the recipe using rotisserie chicken from the grocery store. It is 100% delicious every single time. There are only 2 of us in my home but we eat this for lunches for a week and never get sick of it. We change it up by putting it on different vessels for eating. Our favorites are: tortilla, romaine lettuce leaf, half a hollowed out tomato, or on a halved lengthwise cucumber which has the seeds removed.

I have made this chicken salad twice now and it was fabulous both times. First time I made it exactly as written and the second time I omitted the cheese and water chestnuts. I was in a hurry and simply forgot. It was great either way. Next time I will add the water chestnuts and omit the cheese. The dressing for the salad is delicious.

My family wolfed it down. They decided they wanted a little more "tang" so i will add sweet pickle relish next time
I added dried cranberries this time
I used crushed pecans because that is what I had. They want a little more crunch so I will add more pecans and more celery next time.
Delicious ?? you won’t be disappointed. Easy to make. Even my husband, who is not a fan of chicken salad, loved it

The best chicken salad ever! Every time I serve it, people ask for the recipe!! I use “Bell’s poultry seasoning” from food.com, and leave out the water chestnuts because I never have them. Leave out the Swiss cheese or sub for Gouda as a personal preference. Red grapes for color variation. Serve on croissants for the best chicken salad sandwich ever! My husband has also mastered this recipe so it really deserves 10 stars!

A nice take on chicken salad.
A hit in my home
The best chicken salad recipe I've ever tasted!

I made this thinking it would be a keeper recipe. I followed it exactly and the poultry seasoning was a big turn off. My husband kept tasting this seasoning throughout the afternoon. I wouldn’t make it using this spice but everything else was just ok. Nothing to brag about.
Everyone loved it and I shared the recipe with several people. Thanks Carol!!'
I made no changes, I may have added a little more chicken so I did need to add a little extra mayo. My wife and I both enjoyed it and we will make it again. Thanks

This was awesome! Everyone loved it! I did use apples instead of grapes and used plain greek yogurt instead of mayo but other than that, I left the recipe pretty much the same. 

Next time, I will double the recipe!
Very flavorful. The seasoning is spot on.
I used Miracle Whip and omitted the sliced almonds
This is the best chicken salad I have had.I didn't have a couple of items so, I substituted swiss cheese with 1/4 cup parmessan and skipped poultry seasoning and it still turned out pretty good.

It's chicken salad for petes sake. Omit lemon juice, onion & garlic powders. Use sliced green onion, forget garlic. Miracle whip. Red and green grapes for colour variation or diced apples. Sub walnuts for water chestnuts. Cheese is nice but unnecessary.

Love this recipe! I made some adjustments to account for who I was serving; I left out the water chestnuts and Swiss cheese and added a handful of crushed almonds instead. I also used light Miracle Whip instead of mayo to cut down on the fat content. The seasoning is perfection and this is a big hit in my house!

This recipe blends just the right amount of seasonings to give our neighborhood "tea room" chicken sandwiches some real competition. I added Craisins and omitted the cheese and poultry seasoning. I also used Dukes mayonnaise.
Water chestnuts are a great idea-- they add crunch without the fat from nuts.

The basic recipe looked very inviting but I didn't have all the ingredients. I was also making it for two instead of nine. Besides the chicken and mayo, I used red seedless grapes cut into quarters, vidalia onion minced, a touch of thyme, garlic powder, and salt. I was looking for some sweet to put in my chicken salad made from leftover roti chicken...the grapes were perfect. It was good enough for the fussy eater in my house. I'll be making it again and will stay closer to the original.

I wanted to keep eating this until it was gone. Lots of adjustments: I used walnuts instead of water chestnuts. I bought a whole chicken, quartered it, and poached the chicken breast quarters with thyme, celery, onion, and carrot before dicing the chicken for this salad. Very moist tasty chicken that way. I used less poultry seasoning than recommended. I used purple grapes of course. And I substituted sour cream and vegenaise for half the mayo. No green onions. No swiss cheese needed but might try that next time. It is so good.
Did not add the last 4 ingredients. Will try them the next time. Otherwise it was delicious. I served on mini croissant rolls held together with a toothpick for a party.
Left out the poultry seasoning, cheese and grapes but did add cranberries and sprinkled with dill. Good flavor and not runny at all.

This is my go-to now. The lemon juice adds perfect tang. My husband says the cheese cubes are too squishy and being the same color as the chicken confuse him lol. So I often leave them out, but i love them. Very flavorful with all the seasoning.
amazing salad just the way it said to do it!! However, this is also a salad that i could tweak depending on the items i have in the house !! will make again and again....
This was tasty!. The only thing I would change is a little less poultry seasoning and garlic powder. I didn't have grapes so I substituted Craisins. I will definitely make this again though!
Easy-Peasy to make. Seasoning is great! I used an Old Bay lemon seasoning in place of poultry seasoning, and red grapes for green. Made amazing chicken salad wraps. This recipe is a keeper!
Delicious!
Manque d'assaisonnement. Pas de fromage. Plus de poivre.

We followed recipe exactly and really enjoyed this. Only thing is that next time I would probably leave out the cheese (and I am a cheese lover). If I use the cheese it will be shredded and maybe cheddar instead of Swiss.

Very good after 2 hours chilling; much better the next day. A a few adjustments based on other reviews: I added the seasonings (using 1/2 tsp only of poultry seasoning) and lemon juice to the diced rotisserie chicken, and put that in the fridge while prepping the other ingredients. Used celery, green onions and chopped water chestnuts per the recipe, and black seedless grapes. Subbed about half the mayonnaise with sour cream. A great way to use leftover deli chicken. Served with ritz crackers the first day ... Hubby loved it on sandwiches the next day
Very good. I used almonds instead of water chestnuts. But very nice flavor. Definitely make it again. Also left out the poultry seasoning.
Really good. Did not add salt, water chestnuts or cheese. Not too much sodium or mayo, which is how we prefer it. Will try with apples next. Thank you Carol.
Making it again for 4th of July potluck. I left out onion, added a few more waterchestnuts and going to add a few more grapes this time. Super good!
A bit time consuming, but really worth it when you want a chicken salad that is more special for guests. Delicious !

This is an enjoyable chicken salad. It is savory (if you want a milder flavor you might reduce the pepper & poultry seasoning), but it is good as is! I did not have the cheese, water chestnuts, or onion powder (I used a small amount of minced sweet onion). When I make this again I'll make sure to have the water chestnuts on hand.

I didn't have green grapes or spring onions but otherwise, I followed the directions exactly. Tasty! I LOVED the crunch of the water chestnuts and celery! I mixed everything together the night before and was planning to add the swiss cheese the night before but I simply forgot. I will definitely make this again.
I will definitely make this again. We used sliced Swiss on the bread instead of putting Swiss into the recipe. It was delicious! I also added a tablespoon or so of almond meal and it was great!
Add: 1 t dijon mustard, 1/2 c sour cream, 3/4 c shredded swiss (total), 1/2 c pecans

Odd combination at first, but I decided to give it a try. 
Possible to add a tad mustard to tang it up. Kinda sweet. 
Made family & friends a sandwich with it and they liked it. 
Glad it was a hit & super easy.
This is the best chicken salad ever! Great combination of flavors. I've made it several times.
Went by the recipe exactly except didn't have any poultry seasoning. It was still pretty tasty. Added toasted pecans over romaine lettuce. I'd make it again.
Awesome!
I love this recipe! I used all organic everything and I boiled my chicken, forgot the garlic seasoning and lemon and it was still really good!
I tweaked it by using Kraft mayo with olive oil and by adding sliced almonds but I still found it delicious.

I just made this chicken salad yesterday and must say that the dressing is outstanding. Because I don't care for water chestnuts, I substituted cashews and that was delicious. I also substituted an avocado for the grapes. Everyone asked for the recipe so I think the substitutions were well received. I will definitely be making this chicken salad recipe again.
I'm not a big water chestnut guy, but the rest of the chicken salad was very good.
This recipe is so satisfying--it's very savory. Make a few hours, or a day ahead and let it all marinate together in the fridge. I also tried it with some feta cheese sprinkled on top--delish.
Don't change a thing.. Excellent..
pretty good. the poultry seasoning amount seemed to overpower other flavors. next time i make this i will will the poultry seasoning amount in half. overall really good on a french donut??

Overall, this is a good recipe. I did not include the poultry seasoning, water chestnuts, or Swiss cheese. It was great without them! I also used red grapes instead of green because I only eat red grapes. I’m curious to what the recipe tastes like as is, I just didn’t want to chance it this time.

I made this exactly as directed (except for the green onions) and I wouldn't change anything! I think water chestnuts instead of walnuts is great, it gives it a great texture and crunch. I didn't have green onions on hand so I added some finely chopped yellow onion and it turned out fine, I don't even know if it made that much of a difference. I used fresh chicken breasts and the way I cooked them made the chicken tender and juicy which added to the overall taste and texture I think. I will definitely be making this again!
My family and I love this recipe! I've made it numerous times; just as written and with changes when I don't have grapes or forgot the cheese.
I didn't care for the poultry seasoning flavor. I thought it was way too strong.

This is a pretty yummy recipe. I didn't have the water chestnuts, so I put in some Craisins. Quick to put together for a tasty lunch!
Thanks
Made it with a few changes. Did not add poultry seasoning, onion powder or water chestnuts. Added one small packet of Splenda for sweeter taste. My husband loved it.
I made this for a camping trip for a group of about 30 people. Everyone raved about how good it was! This is now my go-to recipe for chicken salad.

I've been using this recipe as a base for about 10 years. I serve on sandwich rolls at almost all of my kids birthday parties and the guests are never disappointed! I usually season the chicken breasts with salt and rosemary and cook with olive oil. I then toss the chicken into my food processor. What a lifesaver since I'm always making such a large batch and also want it less chunky to go on a sandwich roll. For ease, I use an Italian blend of shredded cheese. I omit the water chestnuts and celery because I think the grapes are the perfect compliment on their own. I make the dressing as stated but sometimes need more or less. Just depends on how much chicken I've cooked.
I would probably like it better without the green onions or with less...they overpower the other ingredients.
This is an amazing "go to" for me. I'm not the best in the kitchen also life is busy, but this takes little time and tastes great! So thankful!
Perfect taste

Made the recipe almost exactly like the instructions. I omitted the water chestnuts and boiled the chicken in chicken broth. It was the best chicken salad that my husband and I have ever had and it went over great with my hunt club. I've now started making it almost once a month because I crave it. Very quick and easy too!
Fabulous. Made for a fundraiser an have been asked again to make them. Getting preorders! Great recipe !

The best chicken salad I've ever eaten. My family loves it. I originally used walnuts and they are perfect for this. On a different occasion, I used almonds. Both are great but we prefer walnuts. Delicious and my go to chicken salad!!
Delicious! I didn't change a thing and my family and friends enjoyed it thoroughly.
I just added some pesto and it made a world of a difference.
This is very good but I cut the poultry seasoning way back. It was just too overpowering at 3/4 tsp.
